metadata.title: CVE-2020-25275 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Dovecot before 2.3.13 has Improper Input Validation in lda, lmtp, and imap,leading to an application crash via a crafted email message with certainchoices for ten thousand MIME parts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-auth-lua - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-core - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-lucene - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-solr - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
dovecot-submissiond - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dovecot package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.3.7.2-1ubuntu3.3').
